storyInfo: The son of the Lord of Long Spring's rebellion is quashed, but an Infected pays the ultimate price.Team Rainbow gathers around his grave to honor his memory, but the battle is not yet over â€” Long Spring is still in chaos.

attributes.content: (Sargonian) ...He went home, and left the world behind.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) Our hearts ache because fate is ever unjust.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) But we need not grieve. Because he is now free from the suffering of existence.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) We sing for him, as he has at last returned to the earth.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) His relatives, his loved ones, need not shed tears.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) Death is a mercy of our world. And we are the heirs to all things.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) ...May it all turn to dust.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) ...May it all return to the wild.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.content: (Sargonian) ...To which we too will one day return.
attributes.name: Elderly Infected

attributes.text: A roughly polished stone monument adorned with a few lines carved into its uneven surface stands in the shadow of a dead tree.
'He was Infected. He was a Doctor.

attributes.content: Are you okay?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: ...Hard to say.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I heard the old lizard man say that only important people get funerals in this country.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Most ordinary folks just die when they die, and their families bury them in the wastes. No tombstones, no mourning.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: The people who live on the huge platforms, the moving cities, have to cremate the dead and bury the ashes under those major roads, since space is so precious in the city.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Cemeteries are rare in an ordinary settlement, where a disaster can come through and wipe out any memory of where the dead are buried.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: There's basically no religion in Sargon. Most people here don't believe in an afterlife. They think the dead return to the earth, and become part of it.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Looking at it like that, it's a pretty honest and practical culture. I like it.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: So Miarow's grave will be lost someday?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Probably. But we held a funeral for him. And that was important.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I can't really accept that.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: After seeing what I saw, it's hard to accept how he went.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: We probably bear some responsibility, Alexsandr.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: If it weren't for Miarow, we would've had a much rougher time here.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I've been thinking, what if we'd moved a little faster? If we were tougher? If we really decided to do something for those sick people?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: If we...
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I don't think it's a good idea to get caught up in thoughts like that.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Miarow made his own choices. This isn't your fault.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: The big girl was trying to fulfill her duty. As an aristocrat growing up in this culture, in this system, her willingness to shelter the sick was definitely a noble act.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Judging by how the Rhodes Islanders talk, Miarow was very, very sick.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: For him, death was something that hung over him every day.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: It's a miracle he lasted as long as he did, in his condition.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: That's how they live. And there's not much we can do about it.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: But did we really do the right thing?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: We were so sure that if we reached out to help them, we would actually be helping them.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: And I have no idea why.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: We lived with those sick people.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: But we didn't know anything about the Infected. We thought of that 'Oripathy' like a slightly infectious cancer, the deadly, incurable disease we already knew.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: But this isn't a disease, really... it's a disaster.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: We don't know anything about it. And we still tried to save them.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: You can't blame yourself for nothing, Cohen.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: It's pointless.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I understand what you're feeling.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: But you can't deny what we did.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Remember when I was up on that roof with nothing to do? I had all that time on my hands.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I sat there, watching Miarow's clinic, watching the people who lived there.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: As a visitor from another world, I witnessed this one.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I'm not a sharp person, but even I could see the many, terrible, cruel things.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: One night, one of the townsfolk was carrying a package from another's house under the cover of darkness.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: It was a burlap-wrapped parcel, about as tall as a man.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I watched them load the package into a handcart and make their way along the edge of town to the rocky desert, disappearing behind the boulders on the south side.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I saw it happen just like that several times. Maybe twice in the past three weeks. And it must have been happening in other places too, where I couldn't see it.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: You never mentioned this before.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I didn't want to say anything. I didn't have a reason to.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: You're right. We're outsiders. We're not from this country. We're not even from this world.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: We can't understand the people here. Their history, their culture, their lives, their feelings, we couldn't hope to know.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: And I have no right to point my finger at something I don't understand. There's a reason they do what they do.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: That's how it should be.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: But then, one night, my curiosity got the better of me. I followed the path to the boulder where they buried the sack.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I saw the light shimmering beneath the sand. I saw the dust rising up from the rocks and dissipating into the air.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: That dust is so bright, in the dark of the night.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I knew, of course, what was in the sack. I could probably guess what the dust was.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: And naturally, we all know exactly what it is now.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: There was an old woman who sat by the door of the house where the sack came from. After that night, I never saw her again.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: KÃ¶tz spent every day with the townsfolk. He must've known about it too.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: What was the excuse you made up before...? Everyone looks like they've had chemical warfare training? They know to cover their noses and mouths? What a lame explanation.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Because I'd seen the reason.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: You just asked me if we really did the right thing.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: The answer is simple: we helped them. Because that's what our morals, our conscience, told us to do.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Aging, illness, and death are inevitable. In this world and ours.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Even if there wasn't this Oripathy, the people wouldn't suffer any less.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Even without the disease, they'd have war, taxation, and natural disasters crushing the poor.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: See their Lord and this town, what kind of a society do they live in?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Such feudalism would be far behind the times in the history of the Earth we know. But it's the reality for them.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: By our standards, they're not living in a civilized world.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I've seen enough *profanity* over the years, Cohen. You know what I mean.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: This world sucks. But there's still something we can do about it.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Don't turn your back on our good work. Morality and conscience aren't wrong.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: ...*Sigh*.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: You're right, Alexsandr.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Forget I said anything. I'm just too tired.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: It's been too long since you got a good night's sleep.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: We're all tired.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Someone's coming.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I don't know what to say. This is all on me.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: Because I was stupid and impulsive.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.text: The tall Reproba holds a golden seal. She grips it tightly, infusing it with her own conviction.
The seal melts and falls from her hand, spilling onto the roughly polished stone tablet.

attributes.content: Originium Arts...
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: That was a medal of honor given to my father by the Lord Ameer. He was one of the Ameer's strongest warriors, and the town of Long Spring was a reward for his service.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: My father was strong, kind, just.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: He always was, ever since I was small.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: The Tulla family was built on the blood and bones of miners.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: For years, my father grew wealthy digging Originium out of the ground.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: But with it came the spread of Oripathy. It was just the miners, at first... but it eventually spread through the town.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: When the Originium closer to the surface was all mined out, my father closed the quarry. He wouldn't let anyone dig any deeper.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: He created the Infected quarter, and sent men to protect the people living there. He couldn't just sit on the pile of Infected corpses and count his gold.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: He always hoped my brother Drudge and I could do better.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: I don't know what happened to Drudge while he was studying in Columbia. I just saw him turn more and more evil.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: It wasn't until my father kicked him out of the house that I realized the man was no longer my brother.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: But I disappointed Father too.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: I'm not a worthy successor to his achievements, or his legacy.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: I'm unworthy.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: I did nothing. I couldn't protect Long Spring. I couldn't protect my father's people. I couldn't even kill Drudge. I let him get away.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: Drudge's supporters, what kind of people are they?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I don't know them well. All I know is that they are from a Columbian organization called Volvort Kochinski.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: It wasn't the first time I dealt with those Columbians...
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: They're wicked and greedy. All they care about is how to dig more rocks out from under the town. They don't give a thought to the people living in it.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: Sounds familiar.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: My father used to say that if I just became a warrior, I could protect my home with strength alone.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: A warrior can defeat another warrior. But violence isn't a solution to true evil.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: ...I never understood what he was referring to with 'true evil'.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: I always thought Drudge had turned evil.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: ...But now I know Drudge was just a tiny little sliver of evil. And it was still enough to beat me.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: There are times when a fight to the death can't solve the problem.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: What are you going to do next?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: I don't know. Drudge ran off, and his mercenaries fell apart.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: But he left behind those monsters. Long Spring isn't really habitable anymore...
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: For the time being, at least, I have to protect my home. That's where the town's survivors are.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: How many people can your home house?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: ......There's a shelter in the basement of the manor. It can hold a lot of people, but we don't have enough food and water.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: Sorry, I shouldn't be complaining to you about these things.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: I actually came to thank you for protecting the people of Long Spring through all this.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: No thanks necessary.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I... I have something I must do. Excuse me.
attributes.name: Picale

attributes.content: She's a good person. It's hard to believe that evil *profanity* is her brother.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Here you are, Miss Cohen.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Did I come at a bad time?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Oh, no. We were just about to leave.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: The Infected gave this to me. It's Dr. Miarow's... estate. In the box.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: After talking it over with the Infected, they decided it would be best to give them to you.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Open it.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Is that proper?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Of course. He was our friend.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: What's inside?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: A map. And a book.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: It's a Sargonian version of 'The Traveler's Guide to Urban Columbia'.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: As for the map... It looks kind of old. Let's see here...
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Oh... This area should be Tkaronto. It's a Columbia border city. I've been there before.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: And is this stack here money?
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Columbian gold certificates... Dr. Miarow actually had some savings.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: I remember he said he would leave here someday and go to a place called Columbia.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: 'To become a real doctor.'
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Short as his time was, he still had a plan for his life.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Hold on. There's a note here. Let me see.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: What does it say?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: ...Should I read it?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: 'If you're reading this note, thank you for helping me deal with this stuff.'
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: 'Give the money to someone. I definitely don't need it anymore.'
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: 'Don't lose the box. It was my mother's.'
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: 'Although I don't know who you are, my friend,'
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: 'I still hope your life turns out okay.'
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: 'â€”â€” Miarow '
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: ...I don't know how to express myself here... What can I do or say in the face of his legacy?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: Dr. Miarow was a strong man.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Dreams are a luxury for the Infected. They're like precious, fragile gemstones.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Even in Columbia, the Infected are zoned to certain areas of the city. Most people live their whole lives struggling to get out of them.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: The vast majority of the time, contracting Oripathy is a death sentence... if a deferred one.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Reality forces you to give up on your dreams, your lifestyle, and ultimately life itself.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: It's hard for anyone to be hopeful about life in the face of cruel reality.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: What on earth was supporting him?
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Someone like Miarow should not have lived like this. He shouldn't have died like this.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Wait, where are you going?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: To find the big girl.
attributes.name: Tachanka

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Ash

attributes.content: I want to talk to her. I have a plan.
attributes.name: Tachanka
